medical_history.chief_complaint: Increasing pelvic pain and difficulty with urination
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has had intermittent diarrhea and increasing pelvic pressure for the past 4 days. For the past day, she has experienced increasing pelvic pain with movement and bowel movements, and new onset difficulty with urination. She denies fever/chills and other symptoms. Prior to this episode, the patient reports doing well with regular bowel movements but intermittent bloating.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic myeloid leukemia (CML), paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, hypertension, chronic kidney disease (CKD), heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF), history of pelvic abscess, sigmoid stricture, history of small intestinal bacterial overgrowth (SIBO), fructose and lactose intolerance, colitis, osteoarthritis, anemia.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had a heart attack, father has hypertension, paternal grandfather may have had stomach cancer, grandmother has unspecified disease.
